com.advantage.framework

Class Framework

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.advantage.framework.Framework
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FirstLogin, HomePage, Login, MySettings, UserRoles

    public class Framework
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is for providing a common way to use Selenium that provides logging for use with page objects.

    This should be the base class used for all page objects.

      static boolean bWaitForAttributeToChange(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element, java.lang.String sAttribute, java.lang.String sInitialValue)
      Waits for the attribute to change on the element.
      Note: You need to save the initial attribute value before doing your action & then calling this method.

      Example:
      sInitialValue = "j_id30";
      WebElement button = Framework.findElement(driver, "javax.faces.ViewState"); button.click();
      Framework.bWaitForAttributeToChange(button, "value", sInitialValue);
      static boolean bWaitForAttributeValue(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, java.lang.String sLocator, java.lang.String sAttributeToCheck, java.lang.String sExpectedAttributeValue)

      static boolean bWaitForDisplayedElement(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element, java.lang.String sElementName)
      Waits for an element to be displayed.

      Notes:
      1) Use if element already exists but it is hidden and you want to wait until it becomes displayed.
      2) Do NOT use if element does not exist instead use same method that takes a WebDriver & Locator.

      static boolean bWaitForURLtoChange(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, java.lang.String sInitialValue, boolean bPartial)
      Waits for the URL to change.
      Note: You need to save the initial URL before doing your action & then calling this method.

      Example:

      sInitialValue = driver.getCurrentUrl();
      button.click();
      Framework.bWaitForURLtoChange(driver, sInitialValue, false);

      static java.lang.String getText(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, java.lang.String sXpath)
      Gets the text regardless whether visible or not (without logging) using the Cobra HTML parser

      Note:
      If there are no matches check that the xpath (which is case sensitive) is in the same case as the HTML source (use driver.getPageSource() to write the actual source to a file/log.)

      Related function:
      Misc.xpathChangeCase(String sXpath, String sDelimiter, boolean bToUppercase) to be used in conjunction with this function to get correct case for xpath.

      • locatedBy

        public static org.openqa.selenium.By locatedBy(java.lang.String sLocateUsing)
        Returns the By Object to locate the element. Allows for selenium 1.0.3 use of locators.
        Supported locators (matches in order):
        xpath: // or xpath=
        name: name=
        css: css=
        link name: link=
        class name: class=
        tag name: tag=
        partial link name: plink=
        id: id= or just id
        Parameters:
        sLocateUsing - - How to locate the element

      • clickAtPage

        public static void clickAtPage(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
               java.lang.String sURL,
               java.lang.String sComplete,
               java.lang.String sType,
               boolean bWaitForActionToStart,
               java.lang.String sActionStartedCheck,
               boolean bJS,
               java.lang.String sLocatorOrJS,
               java.lang.String sLogDetails,
               int nTries)
        If the page is displayed try to click up to the specified times to get to next screen.
        Parameters:
        driver -
        sURL - - Page must contain this URL
        sComplete - - xpath/id to determine when page is completed loading
        sType - - The way to determine page is complete
        bWaitForActionToStart - - True if need to wait for action to start
        sActionStartedCheck - - xpath/id to determine if action has started
        bJS - - true to execute JavaScript else normal click
        sLocatorOrJS - - How to locate the element (button, link, etc.)
        sLogDetails - - What to put in the log
        nTries - - How many times to try and click to get to next page.

      • getText

        public static java.lang.String getText(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                       java.lang.String sXpath)
        Gets the text regardless whether visible or not (without logging) using the Cobra HTML parser

        Note:
        If there are no matches check that the xpath (which is case sensitive) is in the same case as the HTML source (use driver.getPageSource() to write the actual source to a file/log.)

        Related function:
        Misc.xpathChangeCase(String sXpath, String sDelimiter, boolean bToUppercase) to be used in conjunction with this function to get correct case for xpath.
        Parameters:
        driver -
        sXpath - - xpath to node
        Returns:
        text of node if exists or null

      • getAttribute

        public static java.lang.String getAttribute(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                            java.lang.String sXpath,
                            java.lang.String sAttribute)
        Get attribute using Cobra HTML parser instead of Selenium.
        Note: If there are no matches check that the xpath (which is case sensitive) is in the same case as the HTML source (use driver.getPageSource() to write the actual source to a file/log.)
        Parameters:
        driver -
        sXpath - - xpath to node
        sAttribute - - attribute to get
        Returns:
        null if cannot find

      • bWaitForURLtoChange

        public static boolean bWaitForURLtoChange(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                          java.lang.String sInitialValue,
                          boolean bPartial)
        Waits for the URL to change.
        Note: You need to save the initial URL before doing your action & then calling this method.

        Example:

        sInitialValue = driver.getCurrentUrl();
        button.click();
        Framework.bWaitForURLtoChange(driver, sInitialValue, false);
        Parameters:
        driver -
        sInitialValue - - Complete Initial URL or Part of Initial URL that will is expected to change
        bPartial - - true waits until URL no longer contains sInitialValue, false waits until any difference in URL
        Returns:
        true if URL changed before timeout else false

      • clickAndWait

        public static void clickAndWait(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                java.lang.String sElementName)

        Parameters:

        sElementName - - Element Name to log

      • clickAndWaitForURL

        public static void clickAndWaitForURL(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                      java.lang.String sElementName,
                      java.lang.String sPageToWaitFor)
        Clicks the element and waits for the URL to change and contains specified page
        Parameters:
        element - - Element to click
        sElementName - - Element Name to log
        sPageToWaitFor - - Waits until URL contains this value

      • clickAndWait

        public static void clickAndWait(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                java.lang.String sElementName,
                java.lang.String sInitialValue,
                boolean bPartial,
                java.lang.String sValueToWaitFor)
        Clicks the element and waits for the URL to change.
        Note: Use this if you need more control.
        Parameters:
        element - - Element to click
        sElementName - - Element Name to log
        sInitialValue - - Part of Initial URL that will is expected to change
        If null, then current URL is used.
        bPartial - - true waits until URL no longer contains sInitialValue, false waits until any difference in URL
        sValueToWaitFor - - Waits until URL contains this value. If null or empty, then it does not wait.

      • bWaitForAttributeToChange

        public static boolean bWaitForAttributeToChange(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                                java.lang.String sAttribute,
                                java.lang.String sInitialValue)
        Waits for the attribute to change on the element.
        Note: You need to save the initial attribute value before doing your action & then calling this method.

        Example:
        sInitialValue = "j_id30";
        WebElement button = Framework.findElement(driver, "javax.faces.ViewState"); button.click();
        Framework.bWaitForAttributeToChange(button, "value", sInitialValue);
        Parameters:
        element - - Element to perform check against
        sAttribute - - Attribute to wait for changes
        sInitialValue - - Initial value of attribute
        Returns:

        public static boolean bWaitForEnabledElement(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                             java.lang.String sElementName)

        Note: The selenium method isEnabled() returns true in most cases. If this does not work, then try waiting for the element to be displayed.
        Parameters:

        sElementName - - Element Name to log
        Returns:

      • bWaitForDisplayedElement

        public static boolean bWaitForDisplayedElement(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
                               java.lang.String sElementName)
        Waits for an element to be displayed.

        Notes:
        1) Use if element already exists but it is hidden and you want to wait until it becomes displayed.
        2) Do NOT use if element does not exist instead use same method that takes a WebDriver & Locator.
        Parameters:
        element - - Element to wait to be displayed
        sElementName - - Element Name to log
        Returns:
        true if element is displayed before timeout else false

      • verifyField

        public static void verifyField(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
               java.lang.String sExpectedValue)
        Verify that an entered value matches the actual value (case insensitive) only logs a failure

        Notes:
        1) Reads "value" attribute to get actual value used in the comparison
        2) Should only be used for input fields
        3) Use other overloaded method if need to control case comparison or logging level
        Parameters:
        element - - Element (input field) to verify has the correct value
        sExpectedValue - - Expected (entered) value

      • verifyField

        public static void verifyField(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element,
               java.lang.String sExpectedValue,
               boolean bCaseSensitive,
               boolean bLogAll)
        Verify that an entered value matches the actual value

        Notes:
        1) Reads "value" attribute to get actual value used in the comparison
        2) Should only be used for input fields
        Parameters:
        element - - Element (input field) to verify has the correct value
        sExpectedValue - - Expected (entered) value
        bCaseSensitive - - true to do a case sensitive comparison, false to do a case insensitive comparison
        bLogAll - - true to log success as well, false only a failure is logged
